Name: Wife
Text: Couldn't resist my beautiful face, could ya dear?

Name: Detective
Text: (She looked like trouble. Most dames did. People called me old-fashioned for saying that kind of thing, but Ive never been proven wrong.)

Name: Detective
Text: (Still, when it came to putting on events for the city, there was no one better than the mayor's wife.)

Name: Wife
Text: Hello? You're staring? Do you have something to say?

Name: Detective
Text: Pardon my manners. Allow me to introduce myself. I make my money chasing down killers.

Name: Detective
Text: And I'm trying to decide if I'm face-to-face with one.

Name: Wife
Text: Excuse me? I suppose you're talking about the mayor?

Name: Wife
Text: I know we may seem like very different people, but the love we share is real. I'm lost without him.

Name: Wife
Text: I really thought he had what it took to change this city for the better!

Name: Detective
Text: Judging by the news, that respect may not have spread to the bedroom.

Name: Wife
Text: How dare you! I should have you removed right now...

Name: Wife
Text: But the truth is, I could use a little entertainment.

Name: Wife
Text: I spent all day preparing for the event. I hardly had time for trouble.

Name: Detective
Text: I think you're the kind of person who always has room for trouble in their schedule...

Name: Detective
Text: You may not be aware, but the campaign manager hired a sniper to shoot at the mayor.

Name: Wife
Text: Really, now? And you're not arresting him?

Name: Detective
Text: You need at least five brain cells to plot a real murder, and he's about two short.

Name: Detective
Text: No, that was a publicity stunt. But the point is, his sniper had a good vantage point of the backstage.

Name: Detective
Text: And he saw you messing with the trunk of the car right before the murder. Right where the suitcase was.

Name: Wife
Text: So what? Right before the explosion, you said?

Name: Wife
Text: The suitcase was already on the stage then. I couldn't have touched it then

Name: Wife
Text: I may have been looking at the trunk, but it can't be relevant.

Name: Detective
Text: Not if you flip this mystery around.

Name: Detective
Text: (What was the wife doing in the trunk?)

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: See, you weren't putting a bomb in that suitcase. You were actually planting a bomb.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: What? I thought you were going to turn this case around.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: I am. See, we thought the bomb was on the stage with the mayor, but it was actually in the trunk of his car.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: It just launched a missile onto the stage, where he was standing.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: Look, I'm more of a housewife than an event planner, really.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: I'm glad you think I could fix up something like that, but I really can't!

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: Besides, surely the sniper would have seen the missile flying, right?

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: That was just another part of your plan. You used an invisible missile.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: Listen, are you really a private eye?

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: Cause I'm starting to think you're just three kids in a trenchcoat stacked on top of each other.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: (She's on to me...I should back off and rethink this.)

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: The campaign manager wasn't the only one calling a sniper.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: I bet you called another one too, on the other side of the square.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: And this one was ready to shoot you husband dead!

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: But then, what about the bomb? Someone had to plant that.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: Simple. You had a third sniper armed with explosive bullets.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: Meanwhile, your other sniper was poised to shoot the campaign manager's sniper.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: And your fourth sniper-

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: Stop.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: (Maybe I'm getting ahead of myself. What else could she have been up to?)

Name: Detective
Text: The bodyguard claimed that he saw another suitcase at the same time as the mayor was heading to the stage.

Name: Detective
Text: I thought he was lying, but maybe he was telling the truth.

Name: Detective
Text: Maybe there were two suitcases.

Name: Wife
Text: Two suitcases? Now you're speaking nonsense!

Name: Detective
Text: Nonsense is the perfect mask for brilliance.

Name: Detective
Text: You knew if the bomb was planted in the mayor's suitcase, we would be watching that suitcase like hawks.

Name: Detective
Text: The obvious conclusion was that the killer planted a bomb in it.

Name: Detective
Text: It didn't matter what was in it. The papers would be burned beyond recognizability. We'd never know the difference.

Name: Detective
Text: And the mayor had no reason to open the briefcase. If he did, he'd suspect corporate espionage before murder.

Name: Detective
Text: All you had to do was make sure the original suitcase disappeared.

Name: Wife
Text: Now you're just rambling. Maybe I should give you a knock to the head so you stop seeing double.

Name: Wife
Text: How exactly did I make a suitcase disappear from a crime scene, then? The police searched the place thoroughly.

Name: Detective
Text: The truth is, it never left.

Options.Text: Bring up the secret car compartment.
Show a photo of the event.

Name: Detective
Text: You just had to drop it in the compartment in the trunk. That's what the sniper saw you doing.

Name: Detective
Text: That's what makes this perfect. While you had to stop by the trunk, it was only after the mayor went onstage.

Name: Detective
Text: You could stay completely clear of the briefcase in the car...

Name: Detective
Text: And still kill your husband with the briefcase in his hand.

Name: Wife
Text: Oh yeah? And when did I give him that second briefcase then?

Name: Detective
Text: There was only one chance...

Options.Text: Show a picture of the mayor and wife before the speech.
Bring up the mayor being moved at the podium.

Name: Detective
Text: The reporter spotted you meeting with your husband before he hopped on the lift.

Name: Detective
Text: That's when you gave him the suitcase.

Name: Detective
Text: I bet you even told the bodyguard to look for the suitcase in the car so he'd leave you alone.

Name: Detective
Text: The mayor had no reason to doubt you. He would have assumed it leaving the car was an honest mistake.

Name: Wife
Text: Okay, fine, I'll admit I had the opportunity. But how would I have gotten the suitcase in?

Name: Wife
Text: There were guards all over the place. Someone would have seen me bringing in an identical suitcase.

Name: Wife
Text: And I couldn't just leave it lying around. What if someone had opened it?

Name: Detective
Text: You didn't have to worry about that. You knew no one would find it...

Options.Text: Bring up the secret car compartment.
Bring up the timeline of events.
Bring up the conveniently-placed fancy refreshment table.

Name: Detective
Text: You worked hard to book the best refreshments for the crew backstage. You even had a tablecloth and everything.

Name: Detective
Text: That was the perfect place to hide a second briefcase.

Name: Wife
Text: In the table?

Name: Detective
Text: More precisely, on the wheels of the cart you placed the food on.

Name: Detective
Text: All you had to do was carefully push it past the guard.

Name: Detective
Text: Then when no one was looking, you simply pulled the suitcase from below the table...

Name: Detective
Text: And handed it to the mayor, bomb still intact.

Name: Wife
Text: No! No no no! This is outrageous!

Name: Wife
Text: I would never do something like this! It's completely insane!

Name: Wife
Text: You saw me! I was ready to support my husband. I walking up to the stage when it blew!

Name: Wife
Text: If I knew I'd rigged a bomb to explode, I would have stayed backstage. Maybe even taken cover behind the car!

Name: Wife
Text: There's no way I would have risked getting so close to the blast! It could have killed me!

Name: Detective
Text: There's one thing no killer can escape, and that's random chance.

Name: Detective
Text: And here is where your entire crime fell apart.

Name: Detective
Text: (Why did the wife still approach the explosion?)

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: We touched on it before. You may claim you wouldn't have gotten that close to the blast.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: But because you did, you're able to make this argument right here.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: It was all about fixing yourself an alibi.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: Sure, but I nearly lost my eyebrows in that explosion!

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: If I wanted to do that, I would have been much safer about it!

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: I could have stopped on the stairs, or even just hung around the refreshment table.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: There were much less risky ways to protect myself from danger!

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: For a normal person, maybe.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: But I'm willing to bet you were born with an incredible resistance to heat.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: And every night, you go out fighting evil with your incredible powers of flame!

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: I suppose you're speaking for yourself, here?

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: Nah. I'm more into dames that lurk in the shadows.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: I wish. Then I could burn off your hair and see if you're still spouting insane tirades.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: (She's right, I don't know what I'm saying anymore. Let's go through it again. What did she not plan for?)

Options.Text: She wanted to get blown up too.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: You said it yourself, you loved your husband. Which means you couldn't stand to see him gone.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: That's why you got up on the stage so you could join him.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: Boy, you've got a dark imagination there. So some kind of death pact?

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: I'll admit I loved him, but not that much!

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: Well, maybe you just wanted to get injured. Maybe get some cool scars.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: There's a lot of fellas out there who really fall for women with scars. You know, like the type that covers half your face?

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: Especially if it looks like a flame too.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: I suppose you're speaking for yourself, here?

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: Nah. I'm more into dames that lurk in the shadows.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: You know, I didn't want to blow myself up before.

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: But this conversation's making the idea more appealing.

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: (I think I'm barking up the wrong tree. Let's go through it again. What did she not plan for?)

Name: Detective
Text: There's one thing you didn't know about. That's the campaign manager's fake assassination plan.

Name: Detective
Text: Right when you were heading up the stairs, there was a sniper poised aiming at the mayor.

Name: Wife
Text: Dammit!

Name: Detective
Text: The sniper didn't want to kill the mayor, but they needed a close target. They chose the briefcase.

Name: Detective
Text: Generally speaking, the last place you want a bullet is inside a bomb.

Name: Detective
Text: But that's where the sniper's slug ended up.

Name: Wife
Text: Ugh, that stupid campaign manager!

Name: Detective
Text: I bet you wanted the mayor to die way later, after everyone had forgotten about the speech.

Name: Detective
Text: Maybe you even had a detonator. But fate has other plans.

Name: Detective
Text: Because of that stray bullet, your murder weapon went off on that stage, just feet from you.

Name: Detective
Text: You wanted trouble, and you got it. So save me the trouble and fess up.

Name: Detective
Text: What was it, huh? An affair after all?

Name: Wife
Text: No! That's just tabloid garbage! I really did love him!

Name: Wife
Text: Maybe I made mistakes from time to time, but I loved him!

Name: Wife
Text: Maybe I got good opportunities on my plate. Maybe I loved money a little too much!

Name: Wife
Text: Maybe I knew if he really loved me, he'd know he was worth more to me dead than alive!

Name: Wife
Text: But I loved him! I loved him! And I still do!

Name: Wife
Text: I'm sorry, honey! I'm sorry! Please forgive me!

Name: Detective
Text: (It seemed like the dame was always putting up acts. A good husband, a good social front, maybe a good show for the public.)

Name: Detective
Text: (But it seems her last show just wasn't quite good enough.)

Name: Detective
Text: (Case closed.)

Name: Detective
Text: What do you think of this?

Name: Manager
Text: I think you're wasting my valuable time. You know, if you don't mind, I've really got a meeting to catch.

Name: Detective
Text: You'll have to let them know the only place you can meet them is in a cell.

Name: Manager
Text: Maybe you should look into a cell yourself! Cause you're mad if you think that proves anything!

Name: Detective
Text: (She might have a point. That doesn't really make any sense. Am I really ready to take this challenge on?)
